00040 /*============================================================================*/
00041 /* Private data definitions.                                                  */
00042 /*============================================================================*/
00043 
00044 /*
00045  * Max number of algorithms specified in cipher, hash ou MAC functions lists
00046  * (including the default ones).
00047  */
00048 #define LNP_FUNCTION_LIST_SIZE 16
00049 
00050 /*
00051  * Max number of bytes used for a function identifier (including the \0).
00052  */
00053 #define LNP_FUNCTION_MAX_LENGTH 16
00054 
00058 typedef struct {
00059         /* Number of algorithms stored on list. */
00060         int size;
00061         /* List of functions (1 is added for the default algorithms). */
00062         char list[LNP_FUNCTION_LIST_SIZE][LNP_FUNCTION_MAX_LENGTH];
00063 } lnp_function_list_t;
00064

00066 /* Private functions prototypes.                                              */
00067 /*============================================================================*/

00119 /*
00120  * Copies the contents of source into destination, removing the duplicates found
00121  * on source.
00122  */
00123 static void remove_duplicates(lnp_function_list_t *dst,
00124                 lnp_function_list_t *src);
00125                 
00126 /*
00127  * Returns a string that specifies supported cryptographic functions. The format
00128  * of this string is "function1;function2;". */
00129 static char *get_function_string(lnp_function_list_t *function_list);
00130 
00131 /*
00132  * Copies max chars from string to function_sring. If string capacity is not
00133  * enough, function_string is copied until the last function name occurrence.
00134  */
00135 static int copy_function_string(char *string, int max, char *function_string);
00136 
00137 /*
00138  * Replaces the string out with the string in, dealocating out if it
00139  * is not NULL.
00140  */
00141 static void replace_string(char **out, const char *in);
00142 
00143 /*
00144  * Checks file existence.
00145  */
00146 static int file_exists(const char *filename);

00152 /*
00153  * Default number of keys that can be stored on the key respository.
00154  */
00155 #define DEFAULT_KEY_STORE_SIZE  256
00156 /*
00157  * Default name of file containing the node public key.
00158  */
00159 #define DEFAULT_PUBLIC_KEY              "public.key"
00160 /*
00161  * Default name of file containing the node private key.
00162  */
00163 #define DEFAULT_PRIVATE_KEY             "private.key"
00164 /*
00165  * Default list of encryption algorithms.
00166  */
00167 #define DEFAULT_CIPHER_LIST             {1, {"blowfish-cbc"}}
00168 /*
00169  * Default list of hash functions.
00170  */
00171 #define DEFAULT_HASH_LIST               {1, {"sha1"}}
00172 /*
00173  * Default list of MAC algorithms.
00174  */
00175 #define DEFAULT_MAC_LIST                {1, {"sha1-mac"}}
00176 
00177 /*
00178  * Configuration file name.
00179  */
00180 #define CONFIG_FILE_NAME                "lnp.conf"
00181 /*
00182  * Keyword used in configuration file to set the size of the key repository.
00183  */
00184 #define KEY_STORE_SIZE_KEYWORD  "key_store_size"
00185 /*
00186  * Keyword used in configuration file to specify the name of the public key
00187  * file.
00188  */
00189 #define PUBLIC_KEY_FILE_KEYWORD "public_key_file"
00190 /*
00191  * Keyword used in configuration file to specify the name of the private key
00192  * file.
00193  */
00194 #define PRIVATE_KEY_FILE_KEYWORD "private_key_file"
00195 /*
00196  * Keyword used in configuration file to set the list of encryption algorithms.
00197  */
00198 #define CIPHER_LIST_KEYWORD             "cipher_list"
00199 /*
00200  * Keyword used in configuration file to set the list of hash functions.
00201  */
00202 #define HASH_LIST_KEYWORD               "hash_list"
00203 /*
00204  * Keyword used in configuration file to set the list of MAC algorithms.
00205  */
00206 #define MAC_LIST_KEYWORD                "mac_list"
00207 
00208 /*
00209  * check_sanity() constants and return values.
00210  */
00211 #define CONFIG_SANE     0
00212 #define CONFIG_NOT_SANE (-1)
00213 
00214 /*
00215  * file_exists() return values.
00216  */
00217 #define FILE_PRESENT            0
00218 #define FILE_NOT_PRESENT        (-1)
00219 
00220 /*
00221  * lnp_configure() constants.
00222  */
00223 #define DOTCONF_FLAGS                           NONE
00224 #define DOTCONF_NO_CONTEXT_CHECKING     NULL
00225 
00230 typedef struct {
00232         int key_store_size;
00234         char *public_key;
00236         char *private_key;
00238         lnp_function_list_t cipher_list;
00240         lnp_function_list_t hash_list;
00242         lnp_function_list_t mac_list;
00243 } lnp_config_t;
00244 
00245 /*
00246  * Data structure that defines the configuration options used by the parser.
00247  */
00248 static const configoption_t options[] = {
00249         {KEY_STORE_SIZE_KEYWORD, ARG_INT, handle_int, NULL, CTX_ALL},
00250         {PUBLIC_KEY_FILE_KEYWORD, ARG_STR, handle_file, NULL, CTX_ALL},
00251         {PRIVATE_KEY_FILE_KEYWORD, ARG_STR, handle_file, NULL, CTX_ALL},
00252         {CIPHER_LIST_KEYWORD, ARG_LIST, handle_ciphers, NULL, CTX_ALL},
00253         {HASH_LIST_KEYWORD, ARG_LIST, handle_hashes, NULL, CTX_ALL},
00254         {MAC_LIST_KEYWORD, ARG_LIST, handle_macs, NULL, CTX_ALL},
00255         LAST_OPTION
00256 };
00257 
00258 /*
00259  * Default config.
00260  */
00261 #define DEFAULT_CONFIG {                \
00262         DEFAULT_KEY_STORE_SIZE,         \
00263         DEFAULT_PUBLIC_KEY,                     \
00264         DEFAULT_PRIVATE_KEY,            \
00265         DEFAULT_CIPHER_LIST,            \
00266         DEFAULT_HASH_LIST,                      \
00267         DEFAULT_MAC_LIST                        \
00268 }
00269 
00270 /*
00271  * Object that contains the default configuration parameters.
00272  */
00273 static const lnp_config_t default_config = DEFAULT_CONFIG;
00274 
00275 /*
00276  * Object that contains the current configuration parameters.
00277  */
00278 static lnp_config_t current_config = DEFAULT_CONFIG;
00279 
00280 /*
00281  * Strings that store supported functions.
00282  */
00283 static char *cipher_string = NULL;
00284 static char *hash_string = NULL;
00285 static char *mac_string = NULL;
00286 
00287 /*============================================================================*/
00288 /* Public functions implementations.                                          */
00289 /*============================================================================*/
00290 
00291 int lnp_configure(char *config_name) {
00292         configfile_t *config_file = NULL;
00293         
00294         if (config_name == NULL) {
00295                 liblog_warn(LAYER_NET, "configuration file not sent by daemon,"
00296                                 "using default lnp.conf");
00297                 config_name = CONFIG_FILE_NAME;
00298         }
00299 
00300         config_file = dotconf_create(config_name, options,
00301                         DOTCONF_NO_CONTEXT_CHECKING, DOTCONF_FLAGS);
00302 
00303         if (config_file == NULL) {
00304                 liblog_warn(LAYER_NET,
00305                                 "can't find config file, using default parameters.");
00306         } else {
00307                 config_file->errorhandler = (dotconf_errorhandler_t) handle_error;
00308                 liblog_debug(LAYER_NET, "configuration file opened.");
00309 
00310                 if (dotconf_command_loop(config_file) == 0) {
00311                         liblog_error(LAYER_NET, "error parsing config_file.");
00312                 } else {
00313                         liblog_debug(LAYER_NET, "configuration file parsed.");
00314                 }
00315                 dotconf_cleanup(config_file);   
00316                 liblog_debug(LAYER_NET, "resources used by dotconf cleaned.");
00317         }
00318 
00319         if (check_sanity() == CONFIG_NOT_SANE) {
00320                 liblog_warn(LAYER_NET,  "some parameters in configuration are not sane,"
00321                                 "using default values for them.");
00322         }
00323         liblog_debug(LAYER_NET, "configuration file sanity checked.");
00324 
00325         /* Generating strings that specify supported functions. */
00326         cipher_string = get_function_string(&current_config.cipher_list);
00327         hash_string = get_function_string(&current_config.hash_list);
00328         mac_string = get_function_string(&current_config.mac_list);
00329 
00330         liblog_debug(LAYER_NET, "cipher_string: %s.", cipher_string);
00331         liblog_debug(LAYER_NET, "hash_string: %s.", hash_string);
00332         liblog_debug(LAYER_NET, "mac_string: %s.", mac_string);
00333         
00334         if (cipher_string == NULL || hash_string == NULL || mac_string == NULL) {
00335                 liblog_fatal(LAYER_NET, "can't allocate function specifiers.");
00336                 return LNP_ERROR;
00337         }
00338         
00339         return LNP_OK;
00340 }
00341 /******************************************************************************/
00342 void lnp_unconfigure() {
00343         memcpy(&current_config, &default_config, sizeof(lnp_config_t));
00344 
00345         /* Freeing strings allocated on lnp_configure(). */
00346         free(cipher_string);
00347         free(hash_string);
00348         free(mac_string);
00349         
00350         cipher_string = hash_string = mac_string = NULL;
00351 }
00352 /******************************************************************************/
00353 util_cipher_function_t *lnp_cipher_search(char *cipher_list) {
00354         int i;
00355         char *cipher_list_copy;
00356         char *token;
00357         util_cipher_function_t *function;
00358         
00359         cipher_list_copy = (char *)malloc(strlen(cipher_list) + 1);
00360         if (cipher_list_copy == NULL) {
00361                 liblog_fatal(LAYER_NET, "error in malloc: %s.", strerror(errno));
00362                 return NULL;
00363         }
00364         
00365         memcpy(cipher_list_copy, cipher_list, strlen(cipher_list) + 1);
00366 
00367         token = strtok((char *)cipher_list_copy, ";");
00368         while (token != NULL) {
00369                 for (i = 0; i < current_config.cipher_list.size; i++) {
00370                         if (strcmp(token, current_config.cipher_list.list[i]) == 0) {
00371                                 function = util_get_cipher(token);
00372                                 free(cipher_list_copy);
00373                                 return function;
00374                         }
00375                 }
00376                 token = strtok(NULL, ";");
00377         }
00378         free(cipher_list_copy);
00379 
00380         liblog_error(LAYER_NET, "no cipher algorithm negotiated: %s.", 
00381                         cipher_list);
00382         return NULL;
00383 }
00384 /******************************************************************************/
00385 util_hash_function_t *lnp_hash_search(char *hash_list) {
00386         int i;
00387         char *hash_list_copy;
00388         char *token;
00389         util_hash_function_t *function;
00390         
00391         hash_list_copy = (char *)malloc(strlen(hash_list) + 1);
00392         if (hash_list_copy == NULL) {
00393                 liblog_fatal(LAYER_NET, "error in malloc: %s.", strerror(errno));
00394                 return NULL;
00395         }
00396         
00397         memcpy(hash_list_copy, hash_list, strlen(hash_list) + 1);
00398 
00399         token = strtok((char *)hash_list_copy, ";");
00400         while (token != NULL) {
00401                 for (i = 0; i < current_config.hash_list.size; i++) {
00402                         if (strcmp(token, current_config.hash_list.list[i]) == 0) {
00403                                 function = util_get_hash(token);
00404                                 free(hash_list_copy);
00405                                 return function;
00406                         }
00407                 }
00408                 token = strtok(NULL, ";");
00409         }
00410         
00411         free(hash_list_copy);
00412         
00413         liblog_error(LAYER_NET, "no hash algorithm negotiated: %s.", hash_list);
00414         return NULL;
00415 }
00416 /******************************************************************************/
00417 util_mac_function_t *lnp_mac_search(char *mac_list) {
00418         int i;
00419         char *mac_list_copy;
00420         char *token;
00421         util_mac_function_t *function;
00422         
00423         mac_list_copy = (char *)malloc(strlen(mac_list) + 1);
00424         if (mac_list_copy == NULL) {
00425                 liblog_fatal(LAYER_NET, "error in malloc: %s.", strerror(errno));
00426                 return NULL;
00427         }
00428         
00429         memcpy(mac_list_copy, mac_list, strlen(mac_list) + 1);
00430 
00431         token = strtok((char *)mac_list_copy, ";");
00432         while (token != NULL) {
00433                 for (i = 0; i < current_config.mac_list.size; i++) {
00434                         if (strcmp(token, current_config.mac_list.list[i]) == 0) {
00435                                 function = util_get_mac(token);
00436                                 free(mac_list_copy);
00437                                 return function;
00438                         }
00439                 }
00440                 token = strtok(NULL, ";");
00441         }
00442         
00443         free(mac_list_copy);
00444 
00445         liblog_error(LAYER_NET, "no mac algorithm negotiated: %s.", mac_list);
00446         return NULL;
00447 }
00448 /******************************************************************************/
00449 int lnp_get_key_store_size() {
00450         return current_config.key_store_size;
00451 }
00452 /******************************************************************************/
00453 char *lnp_get_public_key_file() {
00454         return current_config.public_key;

00460 /******************************************************************************/
00461 int lnp_get_cipher_string(char *string, int max) {
00462         return copy_function_string(string, max, cipher_string);
00463 }
00464 /******************************************************************************/
00465 int lnp_get_hash_string(char *string, int max) {
00466         return copy_function_string(string, max, hash_string);
00467 }
00468 /******************************************************************************/
00469 int lnp_get_mac_string(char *string, int max) {
00470         return copy_function_string(string, max, mac_string);
00471 }

00473 /*============================================================================*/
00474 /* Private functions implementations.                                         */
00475 /*============================================================================*/
00476 
00477 void set_key_store_size(int key_store_size) {
00478         current_config.key_store_size = key_store_size;
00479 }
00480 /******************************************************************************/
00481 void set_public_key_file(char *filename) {
00482         if (current_config.public_key != default_config.public_key) {
00483                 replace_string(&current_config.public_key, filename);
00484         } else {
00485                 current_config.public_key = filename;
00486         }
00487 }
00488 /******************************************************************************/
00489 void set_private_key_file(char *filename) {
00490         if (current_config.private_key != default_config.private_key) {
00491                 replace_string(&current_config.private_key, filename);
00492         } else {
00493                 current_config.private_key = filename;
00494         }
00495 }
00496 /******************************************************************************/
00497 void set_cipher_list(lnp_function_list_t *cipher_list) {
00498         remove_duplicates(&(current_config.cipher_list), cipher_list);          
00499 }
00500 /******************************************************************************/
00501 void set_hash_list(lnp_function_list_t *hash_list) {
00502         remove_duplicates(&(current_config.hash_list), hash_list);      
00503 }
00504 /******************************************************************************/
00505 void set_mac_list(lnp_function_list_t *mac_list) {
00506         remove_duplicates(&(current_config.mac_list), mac_list);        
00507 }
00508 /******************************************************************************/
00509 DOTCONF_CB(handle_int) {
00510 
00511         if (strcmp(cmd->name, KEY_STORE_SIZE_KEYWORD) == 0) {
00512                 liblog_debug(LAYER_NET, "key_store_size parameter found.");
00513                 set_key_store_size(cmd->data.value);
00514                 return NULL;
00515         }
00516         
00517         return NULL;
00518 }
00519 /******************************************************************************/
00520 DOTCONF_CB(handle_file) {
00521         if (strcmp(cmd->name, PUBLIC_KEY_FILE_KEYWORD) == 0) {
00522                 liblog_debug(LAYER_DAEMON, "public_key_file parameter found.");
00523                 set_public_key_file(cmd->data.str);
00524                 return NULL;
00525         }
00526         
00527         if (strcmp(cmd->name, PRIVATE_KEY_FILE_KEYWORD) == 0) {
00528                 liblog_debug(LAYER_DAEMON, "private_key_file parameter found.");
00529                 set_private_key_file(cmd->data.str);
00530                 return NULL;
00531         }
00532 
00533         return NULL;
00534 }
00535 /******************************************************************************/
00536 DOTCONF_CB(handle_ciphers) {
00537         int i;
00538         int size;
00539         lnp_function_list_t list;
00540         
00541         /* Dotconf only uses 16 arguments in lists, leaving in cmd->data[15]
00542          * the unparsed rest of the string. So we use the first 15 arguments and 
00543          * ignore the rest of them. */
00544         if (cmd->arg_count == CFG_MAX_VALUE) {
00545                 liblog_warn(LAYER_NET, "too much ciphers listed in" \
00546                                 "configuration parameter, using the first 15 specified.");
00547                 size = cmd->arg_count - 1;
00548         } else {
00549                 size = cmd->arg_count;
00550         }
00551         
00552         /* Checking if functions specified are supported. */
00553         list.size = 0;
00554         for (i = 0; i < size; i++) {
00555                 if (util_get_cipher(cmd->data.list[i]) != NULL) {
00556                         strncpy(list.list[list.size++], cmd->data.list[i],
00557                                         LNP_FUNCTION_MAX_LENGTH);
00558                 }
00559         }
00560         /* Copying the default cipher. */
00561         if (list.size > 0) {
00562         strncpy(list.list[list.size++], default_config.cipher_list.list[0],
00563                         LNP_FUNCTION_MAX_LENGTH);
00564         }
00565         set_cipher_list(&list);
00566         
00567         return NULL;
00568 }
00569 /******************************************************************************/
00570 DOTCONF_CB(handle_hashes) {
00571         int i;
00572         int size;
00573         lnp_function_list_t list;
00574         
00575         /* Dotconf only uses 16 arguments in lists, leaving in cmd->data[15]
00576          * the unparsed rest of the string. So we use the first 15 arguments and 
00577          * ignore the rest of them. */
00578         if (cmd->arg_count == CFG_MAX_VALUE) {
00579                 liblog_warn(LAYER_NET, "too much hash functions listed in"
00580                                 "configuration parameter, using the first 15 specified.");
00581                 size = cmd->arg_count - 1;
00582         } else {
00583                 size = cmd->arg_count;
00584         }
00585         
00586         /* Checking if functions specified are supported. */
00587         list.size = 0;
00588         for (i = 0; i < size; i++) {
00589                 if (util_get_hash(cmd->data.list[i]) != NULL) {
00590                         strncpy(list.list[list.size++], cmd->data.list[i],
00591                                         LNP_FUNCTION_MAX_LENGTH);
00592                 }
00593         }
00594         /* Copying the default hash function. */
00595         if (list.size > 0) {
00596                 strncpy(list.list[list.size++], default_config.hash_list.list[0],
00597                         LNP_FUNCTION_MAX_LENGTH);
00598         }
00599         set_hash_list(&list);   
00600         
00601         return NULL;
00602 }
00603 /******************************************************************************/
00604 DOTCONF_CB(handle_macs) {
00605         int i;
00606         int size;
00607         lnp_function_list_t list;
00608         
00609         /* Dotconf only uses 16 arguments in lists, leaving in cmd->data[15]
00610          * the unparsed rest of the string. So we use the first 15 arguments and 
00611          * ignore the rest of them. */
00612         if (cmd->arg_count == CFG_MAX_VALUE) {
00613                 liblog_warn(LAYER_NET, "too much MAC functions listed in" \
00614                                 "configuration parameter, using the first 15 specified.");
00615                 size = cmd->arg_count - 1;
00616         } else {
00617                 size = cmd->arg_count;
00618         }
00619         
00620         /* Checking if functions specified are supported. */
00621         list.size = 0;
00622         for (i = 0; i < size; i++) {
00623                 if (util_get_mac(cmd->data.list[i]) != NULL) {
00624                         strncpy(list.list[list.size++], cmd->data.list[i],
00625                                         LNP_FUNCTION_MAX_LENGTH);
00626                 }
00627         }
00628         /* Copying the default MAC function. */
00629         if (list.size > 0) {
00630                 strncpy(list.list[list.size++], default_config.mac_list.list[0],
00631                                 LNP_FUNCTION_MAX_LENGTH);
00632         }
00633         set_mac_list(&list);
00634         
00635         return NULL;
00636 }
00637 /******************************************************************************/
00638 FUNC_ERRORHANDLER(handle_error) {
00639 
00640         switch (dc_errno) {
00641                 case ERR_PARSE_ERROR:
00642                         liblog_error(LAYER_NET, "line %lu: parse error.",
00643                                         configfile->line);
00644                         break;
00645                 case ERR_UNKNOWN_OPTION:
00646                         liblog_error(LAYER_NET, "line %lu: unknown option.",
00647                                         configfile->line);
00648                         break;
00649                 case ERR_WRONG_ARG_COUNT:
00650                         liblog_error(LAYER_NET, "line %lu: wrong arguments count.",
00651                                         configfile->line);
00652                         break;
00653                 case ERR_INCLUDE_ERROR:
00654                         liblog_error(LAYER_NET, "line %lu: included file not found.",
00655                                         configfile->line);
00656                         break;
00657                 case ERR_NOACCESS:
00658                         liblog_error(LAYER_NET, "acess denied.");
00659                         break;
00660                 default:
00661                         liblog_error(LAYER_NET, "unknown error.");                      
00662         }       
00663         
00664         lnp_unconfigure();
00665         liblog_error(LAYER_NET,
00666                         "error in configuration file parsing, using defaults.");
00667         
00668         return 0;
00669 }
00670 /******************************************************************************/
00671 int check_sanity() {
00672         int return_value = CONFIG_SANE;
00673 
00674         if (current_config.key_store_size < 1) {
00675                 liblog_error(LAYER_NET, "key store size is too small.");
00676                 current_config.key_store_size = DEFAULT_KEY_STORE_SIZE;
00677                 return_value = CONFIG_NOT_SANE;
00678         }
00679         
00680         if (file_exists(current_config.public_key) == FILE_NOT_PRESENT) {
00681                 liblog_error(LAYER_NET, "file not found. (%s)", 
00682                                 current_config.public_key);
00683                 current_config.public_key = DEFAULT_PUBLIC_KEY;
00684                 return_value = CONFIG_NOT_SANE;
00685         }
00686         
00687         if (file_exists(current_config.private_key) == FILE_NOT_PRESENT) {
00688                 liblog_error(LAYER_NET, "file not found. (%s)", 
00689                                 current_config.private_key);
00690                 current_config.private_key = DEFAULT_PRIVATE_KEY;
00691                 return_value = CONFIG_NOT_SANE;
00692         }
00693         
00694         if (current_config.cipher_list.size <= 0) {
00695                 liblog_error(LAYER_NET, "cipher_list is invalid.");
00696                 memcpy(&current_config.cipher_list, &default_config.cipher_list,
00697                                 sizeof(lnp_function_list_t));
00698                 return_value = CONFIG_NOT_SANE;
00699         }
00700         
00701         if (current_config.hash_list.size <= 0) {
00702                 liblog_error(LAYER_NET, "hash_list is invalid.");
00703                 memcpy(&current_config.hash_list, &default_config.hash_list,
00704                                 sizeof(lnp_function_list_t));
00705                 return_value = CONFIG_NOT_SANE;
00706         }
00707         
00708         if (current_config.mac_list.size <= 0) {
00709                 liblog_error(LAYER_NET, "mac_list is invalid.");
00710                 memcpy(&current_config.mac_list, &default_config.mac_list,
00711                                 sizeof(lnp_function_list_t));
00712                 return_value = CONFIG_NOT_SANE;
00713         }
00714         
00715         return return_value;
00716 }
00717 /******************************************************************************/
00718 void remove_duplicates(lnp_function_list_t *dst, lnp_function_list_t *src) {
00719         int i, j;
00720         int found;
00721         
00722         dst->size = 0;
00723         for (i = 0; i < src->size; i++) {
00724                 found = 0;
00725                 for (j = 0; j < dst->size; j++)
00726                         if (strcmp(dst->list[j], src->list[i]) == 0) {
00727                                 found = 1;
00728                                 break;
00729                         }
00730                 if (!found) {
00731                         strncpy(dst->list[dst->size], src->list[i],
00732                                 LNP_FUNCTION_MAX_LENGTH);
00733                         (dst->size)++;
00734                 }       
00735         }
00736 }
00737 /******************************************************************************/
00738 char *get_function_string(lnp_function_list_t *function_list) {
00739         int i;
00740         int length;
00741         char *string;
00742         
00743         length = 0;
00744         for (i = 0; i < function_list->size; i++) {
00745                 length += strlen(function_list->list[i]);
00746         }
00747         
00748         /* Allocating string (length chars plus i ";" plus terminating \0). */
00749         string = (char *)malloc(length + i + 1);
00750         if (string == NULL) {
00751                 liblog_fatal(LAYER_NET, "error in malloc: %s.", strerror(errno));
00752                 return NULL;
00753         }
00754         
00755         /* We start with the null string. */
00756         string[0] = '\0'; 
00757         
00758         for (i = 0; i < function_list->size; i++) {
00759                 length = strlen(function_list->list[i]);
00760                 strncat(string, function_list->list[i], length);
00761                 strncat(string, ";", 1);
00762         }
00763         
00764         return string;
00765 }
00766 /******************************************************************************/
00767 int copy_function_string(char *string, int max, char *function_string) {
00768         int length;
00769         int i;
00770         
00771         length = strlen(function_string);
00772         /* If the string capacity is not enough, we truncate cipher_string to the
00773          * last function name. */
00774         if (length + 1 > max) {
00775                 liblog_warn(LAYER_NET, "too much functions specified, truncating"
00776                                 "to last function identifier.");
00777                 for (i = max - 1; i > 0; i++) {
00778                         if (function_string[i] == ';') {
00779                                 length = i;
00780                                 break;
00781                         }
00782                 }
00783                 memcpy(string, function_string, length);
00784                 string[length] = '\0';
00785                 return LNP_ERROR;
00786         }
00787         
00788         memcpy(string, function_string, length + 1);
00789         
00790         return length + 1;      
00791 }
00792 /******************************************************************************/
00793 void replace_string(char **out, const char *in) {
00794         int string_length;
00795         if (*out != NULL) {
00796                 free(*out);     
00797         }
00798         string_length = strlen(in);
00799         *out = malloc(string_length + 1);
00800         if (*out != NULL) {
00801                 strncpy(*out, in, string_length + 1);
00802         } else {
00803                 liblog_error(LAYER_NET, "could not allocate memory for node_file"       \
00804                                 "parameter. Using NULL file.");
00805         }
00806 }
00807 /******************************************************************************/
00808 int file_exists(const char *filename) {
00809         int ret;
00810         FILE *file;
00811         file = fopen(filename, "r");
00812         if (file == NULL) {
00813                 ret = FILE_NOT_PRESENT; 
00814         } else {
00815                 ret = FILE_PRESENT;
00816                 fclose(file);
00817         }
00818 
00819         return ret;
00820 }
